org.pipservices.runtime

Interface IComponent

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    IAddon, IBootConfig, IBusinessLogic, ICache, IClient, IController, ICounters, IDecorator, IDiscovery, ILogger, IPersistence, IService
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractAddon, AbstractBootConfig, AbstractBusinessLogic, AbstractCache, AbstractClient, AbstractComponent, AbstractController, AbstractCounters, AbstractDecorator, AbstractDiscovery, AbstractLogger, AbstractPersistence, AbstractService, CachedLogger, ConsoleLogger, DirectClient, FileBootConfig, FilePersistence, LogCounters, MemoryCache, MemoryPersistence, NullCache, NullCounters, NullLogger, RestClient, RestService

    public interface IComponent
    The most basic interface that identifies microservice component and it's behavior. It exposes unique component descriptor for identification and allows to manage the component lifecycle to transition between several states:
    • Create - creates a new component instance
    • Configure - sets component configuration parameters
    • Link - sets references to other microservice components
    • Open - performs initialization, opens connections and makes the component ready
    • Close - closes connections, deinitializes component.
    Since:
    2016-05-01
    Version:
    1.1
    Author:
    Seroukhov Seroukhov

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void close()
      Closes the component and all open connections, performs deinitialization steps.
      void configure(ComponentConfig config)
      Sets component configuration parameters and switches from component to 'Configured' state.
      ComponentDescriptor getDescriptor()
      Gets the unique component descriptor that can identify and locate the component inside the microservice.
      int getState()
      Gets the current state of the component.
      void link(DynamicMap context, ComponentSet components)
      Sets references to other microservice components to enable their collaboration.
      void open()
      Opens the component, performs initialization, opens connections to external services and makes the component ready for operations.

    • Method Detail

      • getDescriptor

        ComponentDescriptor getDescriptor()
        Gets the unique component descriptor that can identify and locate the component inside the microservice.
        Returns:
        the unique component descriptor.

      • getState

        int getState()
        Gets the current state of the component.
        Returns:
        the current component state.

      • configure

        void configure(ComponentConfig config)
        throws MicroserviceError
        Sets component configuration parameters and switches from component to 'Configured' state. The configuration is only allowed once right after creation. Attempts to perform reconfiguration will cause an exception.
        Parameters:
        config - the component configuration parameters.
        Throws:
        MicroserviceError - when component is in illegal state or configuration validation fails.

      • link

        void link(DynamicMap context,
          ComponentSet components)
   throws MicroserviceError
        Sets references to other microservice components to enable their collaboration. It is recommended to locate necessary components and cache their references to void performance hit during normal operations. Linking can only be performed once after configuration and will cause an exception when it is called second time or out of order.
        Parameters:
        context - application context
        components - references to microservice components.
        Throws:
        MicroserviceError - when requires components are not found.

      • open

        void open()
   throws MicroserviceError
        Opens the component, performs initialization, opens connections to external services and makes the component ready for operations. Opening can be done multiple times: right after linking or reopening after closure.
        Throws:
        MicroserviceError - when initialization or connections fail.

      • close

        void close()
    throws MicroserviceError
        Closes the component and all open connections, performs deinitialization steps. Closure can only be done from opened state. Attempts to close already closed component or in wrong order will cause exception.
        Throws:
        MicroserviceError - when closure fails.
